name: AMISA2
goal:
The association intends to promote European political information, education, and exchange. To this end
AMISA2 holds monthly debates with key speakers from the European institutions in order to focus the attention of corporate representatives on recent developments in EU policy fields and to make them aware of intended policies.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Banking and financial services, Borders and Security, Budget, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Competition, Consumers, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enlargement, Environment, External Relations, Foreign affairs and security policy, Institutional affairs, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives:
All recent EU policy developments and initiatives that are relevant for business. The participants do not discuss markets, projects or prices and all do respect their code of conduct.
To this end, the only activity of AMISA2 consists of a monthly debate of 90 minutes with key officials and policymakers from the European Institutions and foreign embassies. Topics were:

Single Market Status
The EP Sustainability Agenda
The EIB's Role in strengthening the EU
EU Finances - Crisis Management
Economics of EU Competition Policy
The European Ombudsman - Transparency and Accountability
Financial Policies - Status
MOVE for Growth
Transatlantic Relationships
Framework for Competitiveness and Growth
Circular Economy
European Agenda for Migration
Digital Single Market
The economics of EU competition policy
Climate and Energy in Harmony
Digital Future
Waste Policy
Disinformation
Trading with Europe
The Juncker Commission and the Internal Market
Digital Transport Markets
EU Strategic Outlook
European Defence - NATO and EU
BREXIT
MFF and Financial Instruments
